A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.

22.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
22.str2: To hope, hope for, expect, trust. From elpis; to expect or confide.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.

22.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
22.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
From proseuchomai; prayer; by implication, an oratory.

22.parse: Verb - Future Indicative Passive - 1st Person Singular
22.str2: (a) To show favor to, (b) To pardon, forgive, (c) To show kindness.

22.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
22.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

23.str2: Contracted from Epaphroditos; Epaphras, a Christian.

23.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
23.str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
A fellow captive or prisoner. From sun and aichmalotos; a co-captive.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

23.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
23.str2: To greet, salute, pay my respects to, welcome. To enfold in the arms, i.e. to salute, to welcome.

24.str2: Of Latin origin; Marcus, a Christian.
From the same as ariston and archo; best ruling; Aristarchus, a Macedonian.
Demas, a helper of Paul in Rome. Probably for Demetrios; Demas, a Christian.
Lucas, Luke, Christian physician and writer of the Third Gospel and Acts. Contracted from Latin Lucanus; Lucas, a Christian.

24.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
24.str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
A fellow worker, associate, helper. From a presumed compound of sun and the base of ergon; a co-laborer, i.e. Coadjutor.

25.str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From chairo; graciousness, of manner or act.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
(a) gen: with, in company with, (b) acc: (1) behind, beyond, after, of place, (2) after, of time, with nouns, neut. of adjectives.

25.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
25.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
